meanings.definition: To grow or climb like a vine.
meanings.sent1: The plant was vining up the trellis in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The ivy was vining around the old oak tree.
meanings.sent3: The pumpkin vine was vining so fast, it looked like it was in a race.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were vining through her mind, intertwining and connecting.
meanings.sent5: The grapevines vining along the fence created a beautiful natural curtain.

meanings.sent1: The vining of the grapevines required careful pruning.
meanings.sent2: The vining of the plants in the greenhouse was a meticulous process.
meanings.sent3: The vining of the garden was a sight to behold, like a green carpet.
meanings.sent4: The vining of the pumpkin patch seemed like a magical dance of growth.
meanings.sent5: The vining of the ivy on the wall added a touch of nature indoors.

meanings.sent1: The vining walls of the cottage gave it a charming, rustic look.
meanings.sent2: The vining archway at the entrance was a lovely welcome.
meanings.sent3: The vining balcony was a peaceful spot to relax and enjoy the view.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a vining braid, adorned with tiny flowers.
meanings.sent5: The vining pattern on the fabric added a touch of nature to the room.
